node.title: Victorian government introduces some of Australia's 'heaviest' animal activism punishments
node.alt: A small mob of sheep are pushed up a race, one looks down the camera.
node.description: Trespassing onto Victorian farms could attract fines up to $55,000 under new legislationÂ introduced into state parliament today.
node.content:
["Trespassing onto Victorian farms would\u00a0be subject to what the Andrews government has labelled as \"among\u00a0the heaviest\" punishments in the country, under new legislation\u00a0introduced into the state parliament today.", "In a bid to protect farmers, animal activists found to be illegally entering their properties could face up to\u00a0$10,904 each or\u00a0$54,522 for organisations.", "Minister for Agriculture, Mary-Anne Thomas, said the the\u00a0Livestock Management Amendment (Animal Activism) Bill 2021 recognised the significant biosecurity risks that\u00a0breaches from animal activists can pose.", "\"We know that our farmers work very hard to protect their crops and livestock against pests and diseases and trespassers on farms present a real hazard,\" Ms Thomas said.", "\"This bill will introduce a specific offence with an on-the-spot fine of\u00a0$1,272 for one person, and for offences of a more serious nature they can be taken to the magistrates court.\"", "", "
Three goats were removed from the Gippy Goat Cafe in 2018, sparking a conversation about animal rights activists trespassing on farms.(Supplied: Gippy Goat Cafe)
", "Ms Thomas said the new penalties could be enforced on top of existing fines for trespass.", "
Move welcomed by farmers
", "The\u00a0new measures are in\u00a0response to the\u00a0Inquiry into the Impact of Animal Rights Activism on Victorian Agriculture, which delivered its report to Parliament last year, after a series of events\u00a0involving animal rights activists intimidating farmers, stealing livestock, and disrupting businesses.", "", "
Victorian Farmers Federation President, Emma Germano welcomes the beefed up biosecurity laws.(ABC Central Victoria: Eden Hynninen)
", "Victorian Farmers Federation president, Emma Germano, welcomed the new bill, which she said gave farmers more protection under\u00a0biosecurity management plans (BMPs) which could require\u00a0consent from farmers before entering a property.", "\"A lot of intensive growers are concerned about the biosecurity risks, we've had instances where trespassers have entered chicken sheds or pork facilities,\" she said.", "\"But to be honest, the threat on people's home property,\u00a0that's been the biggest concern of farmers.\"", "", "
Each icon on the Aussie Farms map was clickable and provided\u00a0more information on each listed property.(Image: Aussie Farms)
", "John Gommans,\u00a0a goat farmer from Yarragon who shut his caf\u00e9 after animal activists attended his property in 2019, said\u00a0the experience was \"horrendous.\"", "\"It was a very tough time,\"\u00a0he said.", "An activist who stole livestock from his property was only fined $1, Mr Gommans said.", "\"It changed my view of the law and how the law is enforced,\"\u00a0he said.", "\"But the fines wouldn't have stopped me shutting the caf\u00e9 \u2013 it was the online trolling of the business and everything associated with that.\"", "Despite the legislation not protecting farmers from online abuse, Mr Gommans said it will hopefully physically protect farmers.", "", "
John and Penny\u00a0Gommans used to own the Gippy Goat Cafe in\u00a0Victoria's West Gippsland region.(Supplied: John Gommans)
", "Ms Germano hoped the new legislation would eliminate\u00a0\"inappropriate forms of protest.\"", "\"Threatening farmers, businesses and the animals they profess to protect \u2013\u00a0this is a good step in that direction but we've got to continually\u00a0get that support from the community.\"", "\"It's not okay for people to spout their ideology in that manner.\"", "
Biosecurity dispute
", "Chris Delforce, executive director of the Farm Transparency Project, said\u00a0animal\u00a0activists do not cause a biosecurity threat to farms.", "\"There has not been a single incident of a biosecurity hazard caused by activists, despite hundreds of investigations into farms, slaughterhouses and related facilities by activists over the last 40 years,\" he said.", "\"The Andrews government is\u00a0bowing to industry pressure to prevent consumers from seeing the reality of modern animal agriculture for themselves.", "", "
Animal rights activist, Chris Delforce, said\u00a0biosecurity is being used as an excuse to ramp up fines.(Facebook: Aussie Farms)
", "\"Were these industries transparent and honest about what happens inside these facilities, there\u2019d be no need for anyone to take it upon themselves to capture evidence of it."]
